It's often seasoned with salt and pepper. The soup is cooked by simmering the ingredients in a stock or broth until the clams are cooked and tender. Visually, it appears smooth with small chunks of potatoes and herbs floating on top, giving it a rich and comforting appearance.

It often has a white, smooth texture with visible chunks of potato and clam.	<>	Clam chowder is a creamy soup typically made with clams, potatoes, onions, celery, and milk, cooked in a rich broth. It has a thick, smooth texture and is garnished with a dollop of sour cream and croutons.

It is simmered until the flavors meld, creating a rich and hearty dish. Visually, it has a smooth, slightly opaque appearance with visible clams and subtle flecks of herbs floating within the broth.	<>	Clam chowder is a creamy soup made with clams, potatoes, onions, and herbs, cooked in a broth, served with crusty bread on the side, featuring a smooth, light tan color and small, scattered clumps visible in the broth.	<>	Clam chowder, a creamy soup, is made with clams, potatoes, onions, and celery, simmered in a broth with herbs and spices, resulting in a thick, hearty, and visually appealing dish.	<>	Clam chowder is a creamy soup made by simmering clams, onions, potatoes, and herbs in milk or cream, often seasoned with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. It has a thick, white base, visible herbs, and a smooth texture, with pieces of potato and clam visible within.	<>	Clam chowder is a creamy white soup typically made with clams, potatoes, onions, and celery, often seasoned with thyme and bay leaves. It is cooked by simmering these ingredients in a rich, buttery broth until the flavors meld. The soup is characterized by a smooth, velvety texture and a light, savory flavor, often garnished with fresh bread or a crusty roll.
